works.complaint:
We act on behalf of Tom Creamer and Telesure Investment  
Holdings (Pty) Ltd (hereinafter referred to as “our clients”), who have  
requested us to address this letter to you.

 From the outset, we wish to make it clear that this letter is not intended  
to be exhaustive of all matters and issues and, insofar as may be  
necessary, we reserve the right to canvas same at the appropriate time and  
in the appropriate forum should it become necessary to do so.

Our clients recently became aware of a listing entitled “Drug Bust of  
Telesure Holdings MD” upon conducting a search on your www.google.co.za  
website with the words “Telesure MD”. Upon clicking this link a user is  
directed to a post on the www.scribd.com website where a  
matthew_jorgedesousa has uploaded content which is unlawful, offensive and  
disparages our clients’ good name.

We record that the content is false and defamatory and based on events that  
did not occur.
As you are aware our client, Telesure Investment Holdings (Pty) Ltd, is a  
leading insurance provider, and there is no doubt that members of the  
public may become aware of these posts and read the inappropriate content  
about our clients Managing Director and as a result this will negatively  
impact both of our clients.
In the circumstances, we have reported this content to Scribd Inc. and  
further addressed a letter to them on 23 July 2012. To date, Scribd Inc.  
has failed to remove the content and as a result, our clients have  
instructed us to proceed with instituting legal proceedings in the United  
States of America. Our clients are proceeding with what is referred to as a  
“john doe” action in San Francisco, California against this posting and a  
further action which serves a third party subpoena for discovery of the IP  
address on www.scribd.com.
After obtaining judgment our clients will proceed with an application for  
the removal of the content and a defamation action against the user and  
claim any related damages that it has suffered.
